sections.heading: Short title.Section 31-28-2 - Definition
sections.text:
Chapter 31, Article 28 NMSA 1978 may be cited as the "Crime Reduction Grant Act".

History:Laws 2019, ch. 192, § 5; 2022, ch. 56, § 31.

The 2022 amendment,effective May 18, 2022, changed "Section 5 through 10 of this act" to "Chapter 31, Article 28 NMSA 1978".

sections.heading: Definition.
sections.text:
As used in the Crime Reduction Grant Act, "commission" means the New Mexico sentencing commission.

History:Laws 2019, ch. 192, § 6; 2023, ch. 60, § 1.

The 2023 amendment,effective June 16, 2023, removed the definition of "grant administrative agency" from the Crime Reduction Grant Act; and deleted former Subsection B.

sections.heading: Criminal justice coordinating councils created; composition; duties.
Applications for grants; purposes; conditions.
Rules.
sections.text:
The commission shall promulgate uniform procedural rules necessary to administer the provisions of the Crime Reduction Grant Act.

History:Laws 2019, ch. 192, § 9; 2023, ch. 60, § 4.

The 2023 amendment,effective June 16, 2023, removed references to "grant administration agencies"; after "commission", deleted "in consultation with each grant administration agency", and deleted "Each grant administration agency shall adopt the uniform procedures along with other grant award criteria unique to the grant administration agency.".

sections.heading: Reports.
sections.text:
The commission shall report to the legislature annually by November 1 of each year regarding the:

A. applications for grants made during the previous fiscal year by each criminal justice coordinating council;

B. purpose and amount of each grant approved by the commission for each member for the previous fiscal year; and

C. processes, outputs and outcomes resulting from the use of the grant.

History:Laws 2019, ch. 192, § 10; 2023, ch. 60, § 5.

The 2023 amendment,effective June 16, 2023, revised reporting procedures related to crime reduction grants; redesignated former Paragraphs A(1) through A(3) as Subsections A through C, respectively; in the introductory clause, deleted "Each grant administration agency" and added "The commission", and after "shall report to the", deleted "commission" and added "legislature"; in Subsection B, after "approved by the", deleted "grant administration agency" and added "commission"; and deleted former Subsection B, which related to certain data sharing reporting requirements.

sections.heading: Crime reduction grant fund created; purpose.
sections.text:
The "crime reduction grant fund" is created as a nonreverting fund in the state treasury. The fund consists of appropriations, gifts, grants and donations. The commission shall administer the fund, and money in the fund is subject to appropriation to the commission to administer the provisions of the Crime Reduction Grant Act and award crime reduction grants to members of criminal justice coordinating councils to spur local innovation in criminal justice reform, pursuant to the Crime Reduction Grant Act. Expenditures from the fund shall be made on warrant of the secretary of finance and administration pursuant to vouchers signed by the chair of the commission or the chair's authorized representative. The commission may expend no more than three percent of the balance of the fund each fiscal year for administering the Crime Reduction Grant Act. No money in the fund may be expended in any way except as provided by the Crime Reduction Grant Act.

History:Laws 2023, ch. 60, § 6.

Effective dates.— Laws 2023, ch. 60 contained no effective date provision, but, pursuant to N.M. Const., art. IV, § 23, was effective June 16, 2023, 90 days after adjournment of the legislature.
